element.name: TCustomGrid
element.short: The base class for all grid controls

descr.p: A grid is a collection of cells that are organized in columns and rows. Grids are adequate to show data that have tabular nature, for example tables in a database.
The ColCount and RowCount properties contain the column and row count of the grid.
The FixedCols and FixedRows properties specify the count of fixed columns or rows that are used for headings.
The column widths and row heights of the grid are accessible with the ColWidths and RowHeights properties.
The DefaultColWidth and DefaultRowHeight properties are used to specify default column widths or row heights respectively.

The colors of the cells and the grid elements are specified with the AlternateColor, BorderColor, FixedColor, FixedHotColor, FocusColor, GridLineColor and SelectedColor properties. The GridWidth and GridHeight properties contain the dimension of the entire grid.
The ScrollBars property controls the creation of scrollbars for the grid.
The LeftCol, TopRow, VisibleColCount and VisibleRowCount properties contain information about the visible area of the grid.
The Options property controls options for the grid.
If the user highlights a cell of the grid, the SelectCell method is called that triggers the OnSelectCell event. The position of the highlighted cell is stored within the Col and Row property.
The MouseToCell method calculates a grid cell from a given screen position.
Huge changes to the grid should be encapsulated in calls to BeginUpdate and EndUpdate to speed up the application.
Component developers must override the DrawCell method in customized grids.

element.name: TCustomGrid.BeforeMoveSelection
element.descr:
This method is called from TCustomGrid.MoveExtend method whenever the current grid cursor location is about to change. The destination column and row are specified in DCol and DRow parameters respectively.
The new location is known to be a valid selectable cell (see ), and is given in absolute cell coordinates. At this point the current grid location has not changed and can be retrieved with Col and Row properties.
The purpose of this method is to call event handler OnBeforeSelection.

element.name: TCustomGrid.ScrollBarShow
element.descr:
Change the appearance of the scrollbars in the grid.
'Which' can be any of : SB_BOTH, SB_VERT, SB_HORZ 'aValue' can be True or False

element.name: TCustomGrid.ScrollBarAutomatic
element.descr:
Check if scrollbars are shown automatically by the grid or not.
'Which' can be any of : SB_BOTH, SB_VERT, SB_HORZ

element.name: TCustomGrid.SelectCell
element.short: Is called if a grid cell is highlighted.

descr.p: The SelectCell method is called if a grid cell will be highlighted.
The aCol and aRow parameters contain the column and the row of the highlighted cell.

Component developers may use the SelectCell method to react on focus changes. The Result is true if the cell is allowed to be selected. Application developers should use the OnSelectCell event instead.

element.name: TCustomGrid.Sort
element.descr: Method to sort all items in the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.AutoAdvance
element.short: Automatically advance down the grid on successive mouse clicks

element.name: TCustomGrid.AutoFillColumns
element.short: Automatically fill columns with default values if nothing else specified

element.name: TCustomGrid.Col
element.descr: Col property holds the column index of the current grid cell cursor. The current grid column can be changed programatically by setting a new value to this property.

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColCount
element.short: Number of columns of the grid.
element.descr: This is the number of columns in the grid, including fixed and normal columns.

descr.p: The column is specified with the aCol parameter. The aCol parameter must fall within the valid index range of 0 to ColCount-1.
The return value of the property is the width of this column, measured in pixels.
The initial width of a newly created column is specified with the DefaultColWidth property. After that the user may redefine this value.
If the Options property includes the appropriate value, the column width may also be changed by the user at runtime.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DefaultColWidth
element.short: Default value for the width of newly created grid columns.

descr.p: If new columns of the grid are created by changing the ColCount property, the width of these new columns will be set to the value of the DefaultColWidth property.
After that the user may redefine this value. If the Options property includes the appropriate value, the column width may also be changed by the user at runtime.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DefaultRowHeight
element.short: Default value for the height of newly created grid rows.

descr.p: If new rows of the grid are created by changing the RowCount property, the height of these new rows will be set to the value of the DefaultRowHeight property.
After that the user may redefine this value. If the Options property includes the appropriate value, the row height may also be changed by the user at runtime.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DefaultTextStyle
element.short: Default style for displaying text - includes alignment, layout, single or multi-lines

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorMode
element.short: Is grid ready to accept edits (EditorMode True)

element.name: TCustomGrid.FixedCols
element.short: Number of the fixed columns of the grid.

descr.p: Contains the fixed column count of a grid.
Fixed columns are normally used for headings.

element.name: TCustomGrid.FixedRows
element.short: Number of the fixed rows of the grid.

descr.p: Contains the fixed row count of a grid.
Fixed rows are normally used for headings.

element.name: TCustomGrid.FixedColor
element.short: The color for the fixed cells of the grid.

element.name: TCustomGrid.GridLineColor
element.short: Colour to be used for GridLines

element.name: TCustomGrid.GridLineStyle
element.short: Style to be used for GridLines

element.name: TCustomGrid.RowCount
element.short: Number of rows in the grid
element.descr: This is the number of rows in the grid, including fixed and normal rows.

element.name: TCustomGrid.RowHeights
element.short: The row heights for the grid.

descr.p: The row is specified with the aRow parameter. The aRow parameter must fall within the valid index range of 0 to RowCount-1.
The return value of the property is the height of this row, measured in pixels.

The initial height of a newly created row is specified with the DefaultRowHeight property. After that the user may redefine this value. If the Options property includes the appropriate value, the row height may also be changed by the user at runtime.

element.name: TCustomGrid.SelectedColor
element.short: Colour to be used for selected cells

element.name: TCustomGrid.ScrollBars
element.short: The ScrollBars to be used with this grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnSelection
element.short: Is called after a grid cell is highlighted.
element.descr:
The Col and Row parameters contain the column and the row of the highlighted cell.
Application developers may use the OnSelection and OnBeforeSelection events to react on focus changes. Component developers should use the SelectCell method instead.

element.name: TCustomGrid.Clear
element.short: clear all cells from the grid.

descr.p: Reset Column and Row counts to 0. Grid is completely emptied.
Compatibility: This property applies to Lazarus grids only , under Delphi/Kylix a grid can't be completly emptied.

element.name: DrawRubberRect
element.descr: Draw a rubberband around the provided cellrect Segunda linea de texto
